data.text: In our latest Back to Basics video, we explain why global public goods are important and why countries should come together to protect and maintain them. https://t.co/3xp6MqwPuW https://t.co/MaUc2A3CAA

The price of food has steadily increased in sub-Saharan Africa since 2019. The outlook is uncertain—inflated prices could persist if disruptions to the supply chain continue. https://t.co/qYWgCnYGMD #IMFBlog #IMFAfrica https://t.co/4oIfdXe4Zn

The world needs more low-carbon energy technologies because of climate change and the transition could unleash an unprecedented demand for metals. Whose mining operations are up to the task? https://t.co/0XBzasNeg1 #IMFBlog https://t.co/Ar27T05D2z

In May, the IMF released a comprehensive road map to overcome the pandemic, save lives, and ensure a broad-based economic recovery.
 
In our new #FandD, @GitaGopinath and @Ruchir_Agar assess how the world has fared since the road map’s  release. https://t.co/zx0LvEFQCu https://t.co/xSHGwcTsV2

The recovery from the pandemic gives 🇩🇿 Algeria a chance to rebuild resilience and harness the potential of its young people. Read more about Algeria’s economic recovery in our latest #IMFCountryFocus article. https://t.co/J3plifUx9t https://t.co/6PVSGECfNu

The Common Framework created to help restructure the debt of low-income countries is yet to deliver on its promise. G20 and private creditors need to take steps to make it work better, say the IMF’s @KGeorgieva and @CeylaP_IMF in a new blog: https://t.co/ZWSOjMODOI https://t.co/GZDmS7MSN7
